intro: Cucurbita moschata var. pusilla, commonly known as the Mexican pumpkin or little bear pumpkin, is a compact, trailing vine that produces small, round to oval fruits. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The fruit typically measures 5–10 cm in diameter and has a sweet, nutty flavor with a dense, orange-colored flesh. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and as a decorative element in gardens. This variety is also valued for its use in traditional cooking and as a source of seeds.
